page.title: 03Wormleighton Farming Year
page.content: From January to March all mechanical and outside repair work is completed. Middle of March the sheep commence lambing which necessitates attention day and night for some weeks.The arable crops are sprayed to deter weeds or with fertiliser. Early June the grass is made into silage and stacked in clamps closely followed by haymaking which is stacked in barns. There are many intermittent tasks to be fitted in with seasonal work, sheep are shorn, dipped, followed by lambing, weaning, and sale. Ground is prepared and planted with kale for winter forage. In July winter barley is ready for harvesting, cereal harvest is completed by September, ploughing and reseeding follows. September cows commence calving. The autumn brings the culling of all stock.
